node.title: Dimetrius Pairama's murderers to appeal convictions and sentences
node.description: Two people who kidnapped, tortured and hanged a 17-year-old will begin to appeal their convictions and prison sentences today.
node.content:
["Two people who kidnapped, tortured and hanged a 17-year-old will begin to appeal their convictions and prison sentences today.", "", "
Kerry Te Amo and Toko Shane Rei Winter were found guilty of the murder in 2019. Photo: RNZ / Claire Eastham-Farrelly
", "Kerry Te Amo and Toko Shane Rei Winter were found guilty of murdering Dimetrius Pairama after a three-week trial at the High Court in Auckland in 2019.", "The teenager's body was found in a drum at a derelict house in Māngere in July 2018.", "Both were jailed for life.", "The hearing at the Court of Appeal in Wellington will be done remotely, beginning at 10am."]
